inputs.selection_motivation: US Inflation Expectations are a primary driver of Fed policy decisions, as the Fed adjusts policy to anchor expectations and maintain inflation targets.
inputs.candidate_motivation: These topics are the most direct macro signals that can influence or reflect US inflation expectations, including monetary policy, actual inflation data, and policy-driven price pressures (tariffs). They also cover related market variables (yields and stocks) that interact with and help shape inflation expectations.

proposed_link.motivation: US Inflation Expectations are a primary driver of Fed policy decisions, as the Fed adjusts policy to anchor expectations and maintain inflation targets.
